Level 5 perks:
 • ACUITY: you discover a new cold weapon, making it easier to deal with enemies
 • PARAMEDIC: bandages provide a slight amount of healing
 • HEALTH PROMOTION: vodka reduces more radiation, but you get intoxicated faster
 
Level 10 perks:
 • GONZALEZ: you discover an artefact that allows you to run around with additional stamina
 • ASPIRANT: anti-radiation drugs become more effective
 • LEGEND: you can recruit additional stalkers into a squad
 • DISCIPLE: zombified stalkers become neutral to you
 
Level 20 perks:
 • HERCULES: you discover an artefact that allows additional storage in your backpack
 • METALLIC: you discover an artefact that increases your bullet resistance
 
 • BOUNDLESS: your PDA can now display the location of every living soul throughout the Zone
 • TECHNICIAN’S FRIEND: all technicians of the Zone know you like no other, and they can offer you drinks, company, and all kinds of upgrades
 • WEALTHY CLIENT: traders offer you expensive products more frequently
 
Level 25 perks:
 • ???: Nobody knows.
 • INCREASED METABOLISM: you discover an artefact that helps you regenerate at the highest speed

Perks are different kinds of special abilities for you to obtain. From the beginning of the game, none are available to you, although after level 5, three perks become unlockable. After 10, 4 additional perks become available; 5 perks become available after level 20; and the last 2 perks become available after level 25. Here, you are (almost) not limited to any choice, and you can choose all perks at once if you have the necessary skill points and the required level.

The Strength skill will allow you to carry heavy arms and armour, as well as kick small mutants and operate gauss rifles. At level 2, you rarely receive critical damage, and at level 5, the effect is reduced to a minimum when it does appear.

The Medicine skill allows for more effective use of first-aid kits and medical capsules. The higher the level of the skill, the more your health will increase after using medical supplies. As you progress from level 2, you can learn how to disassemble medical supplies for personal use and gradually improve the benefits that can be obtained from them.

The Looting skill allows you to collect money from dead stalkers and steal caches after receiving training (starting at level 2). At level 4, the chance of discovering stash coordinates increases. At level 5, you can learn to rob the arsenals of larger factions with a key card.
The Repair skill allows you to use repair kits for repairing weapons and armour by yourself. Further increasing the skill raises the overall effectiveness of independent repairs.
The Survival skill allows you to carve up mutant carcasses, reduce health loss when consuming raw meat, make the most out of all types of food, and also minimise damage from harmful artefacts.

The levelling system will allow you to turn from a novice into a warlord! Unable to carry a 10 kg suit? Attain experience and acquire the Power skill! Or perhaps you haven’t acquired the know-how to utilise the first-aid kit to its full potential? Get the Medicine skill! Incapable of grabbing an artefact without getting hurt? What do you know about survival?! And so on.
